SEARCH
Package com.ecom.utils

Class DynamicXpath

java.lang.Object
com.ecom.utils.DynamicXpath
public final class DynamicXpath extends Object
DynamicXpath class for generating dynamic XPath expressions.

This class provides a method to create dynamic XPath expressions by replacing placeholders in a base XPath with specific values.

Example usage:

 
 String baseXpath = "//div[text()='%s']";
 String actualXpath = DynamicXpath.getXpath(baseXpath, "ExampleText");
 // The actualXpath will be "//div[text()='ExampleText']"

  • Method Details

    • getXpath

      public static String getXpath(String baseXpath, String replaceValue)
      Generates a dynamic XPath by replacing a placeholder in the base XPath with a specified value.

      This method uses String.format(String, Object...) to replace the placeholder in the base XPath (specified by '%s') with the given replacement value.

      Parameters:
      baseXpath - the base XPath expression containing a placeholder (e.g., "//div[text()='%s']").
      replaceValue - the value to replace the placeholder in the base XPath.
      Returns:
      the generated XPath with the placeholder replaced by the specified value.
